template.name: SNMP Telos ZIPStream-X2
template.description:
## Description
Telos Z/IPStream-X2 SNMP Template. Created by Roman Ermakov r.ermakov@emg.fm v1.0 - 2019-01-29 - Initial release Usage notes: 1. Install and configure SNMP Service on your Windows server; 2. Install and activate ZIPStream software; 3. Run: C: Program Files (x86) ZIPStream X2 snmpmgr.exe register 4. Restart SNMP Service If you need the MIB, get TLSCORP-ZIPSTREAM-X2-MIB.txt from installation folder.
## Overview
Template for **Telos Z/IP Stream X2** software with SNMP management.
<https://www.telosalliance.com/Telos/ZIPStream-X2>
**Items features:**
* Count of Audio sources * Count of Audio sources with errors * Count of Audio sources with silence * Count of Live Streams * Count of Live Streams with errors * Product name * Product version
**Triggers features:**
* Last two checks - streams have errors; audio sources have silence
**Discovery features:**
* Items: Livewire sources and destinations Enabled/Disabled, Address, Name, Gain etc. * Triggers: Gain changed, Source Address changed, Port disabled
**Usage notes:**
1. Install and configure SNMP Service on your Windows server; 2. Install and activate ZIPStream software; 3. Run: *C:\Program Files (x86)\ZIPStream X2\snmpmgr.exe register* 4. Restart SNMP Service
If you need the MIB get TLSCORP-ZIPSTREAM-X2-MIB.txt from installation folder.
## Author
Roman Ermakov

trigger.name: ZIPStream Audio Sources count was changed

item.name: audio-sources-errors
item.description: Count of audio sources which have errors

trigger.name: ZIPStream Audio Sources have errors
trigger.description: Last two checks shows that Audio Sources have errors

item.description: Count of audio sources which have silence detected

trigger.name: ZIPStream Audio Sources have silence
trigger.description: Last two checks shows that Audio Sources have silence

trigger.name: ZIPStream Live Streams count was changed

item.name: streams-errors
item.description: Count of live streams which have errors

trigger.name: ZIPStream Live Streams have errors
trigger.description: Last two checks shows that LIve Streams have errors

discovery_rule.name: dstEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing management information applicable to a particular destination.

trigger_prototype.name: Livewire Audio Desination Gain for Ch.{#SNMPINDEX} was changed

item_prototype.name: dstIndex for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each destination. It is recommended that values are assigned contiguously starting from 1. The value for each port sub-layer must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re- initialization.

item_prototype.name: dstMediaAddress for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing the media address (URI).

trigger_prototype.name: Livewire Destination address for Ch.{#SNMPINDEX} was changed

item_prototype.name: dstName for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing label of the destination port.

item_prototype.name: dstNumberOfChannels for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A number of audio channels. Which values are accepted depends on the other port configuration. Some ports are bundled as stereo or surround groups. 0 - port not available 1 - mono 2 - stereo 8 - 8-channel surround (5.1 + stereo)

item_prototype.name: dstOutputMode for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Channel ouput mode. Default mode is apassing all channels. Mono destinations can be left-only, right-only or left+righ sum.

discovery_rule.name: srcEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing management information applicable to a particular source port.

trigger_prototype.name: Livewire Audio Gain for Ch.{#SNMPINDEX} was changed

item_prototype.name: srcEnable for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: This object has a value of false(2) if this port is disabled. This object has a value of true(1) when the source port is enabled. Source port needs to be enabled in order to transmit multicast stream or accept unicast connections.

item_prototype.name: srcIndex for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each destination. It is recommended that values are assigned contiguously starting from 1. The value for each port sub-layer must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re- initialization.

item_prototype.name: srcMediaAddress for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: IPv4 multicast destination address for the RTP media stream, or empty (0.0.0.0) for unicast-only ports.

trigger_prototype.name: Livewire Source address for Ch.{#SNMPINDEX} was changed

item_prototype.name: srcMediaPort for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: UDP port number the RTP media stream is sent to. Used for multicast streaming only. 0 - use RTP default port 5004.

item_prototype.name: srcName for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing label of the destination port.

item_prototype.name: srcNumberOfChannels for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A number of audio channels. Which values are accepted depends on the other port configuration. Some ports are bundled as stereo or surround groups. 0 - port not available 1 - mono (left or right only) 2 - stereo 8 - 8-channel surround (5.1 + stereo)

item_prototype.name: srcPacketSize for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A numeric value for number of samples per each RTP media packet. Common values are: 12 - Livewire Livestreams (channels with mininum latency) 48 - AES67 1ms packet (low-latency, best interoperability) 240 - Livewire Standard Streams (least resource intensive)
